item.title: Amara Raja Infra sets up India's first green hydrogen fuelling station in Leh
item.description: India's first green hydrogen fueling station is ready in Leh. Amara Raja Infra built the station for NTPC. The station can produce 80kg of green hydrogen daily. Five hydrogen fuel cell buses will now operate in Leh. The station will help expand green hydrogen projects across India. This supports the National Hydrogen Energy Mission.

item.title: Rivian snags $6.6B conditional federal loan to build Georgia factory
item.description:
Rivian said late Monday it has secured conditional commitment for a $6.6 billion loan from the Department of Energy, funds that will help the EV maker restart construction of a massive factory in Georgia. The funds will come from DOE’s Loan Programs Office Advanced Technology Vehicle Manufacturing Loan Program. Rivian said it expects to begin […]
